answers.answer: Impetigo and diabetes come to mind first, but it could be caused by other factors as well.Do you apply bandages to the cuts? If so it could be an allergic reaction to the tape or to the medication ( if used ).Could be from an infection as well. This is the most likely cause, and happens to people with diabetes, and immune problems.See a doctor just to make sure.

question: For the last couple of weeks anytime I get a small cut on my hands, it turns into a fluid filled blister. The cut becomes painful and takes awhile to heal. Most of the time the cut won't heal until I squeeze all the fluid/blood out. What could be causing this?
title: Cuts turning into blisters
